comment: I took his ART 2990 class during the summer and it was very easy and straightforward with projects being evenly spaced during a week, and allowing peer interaction to strive in discussions, while being remote and online. Provided also very good and insightful opinions on every student's project, which is nice to see the professor interact.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: makes course difficult for no reason, will fail
Never take him. Terrible harsh grader. Guaranteed to fail
Absolutely not

This professor is very critical, and not in a helpful way. He will fail you by his own opinion on whether you're “good enough” or not. His way of balancing that is comparing you to other students. If he simply does not like your work just cause he WILL fail you. His grading isnt based off syllabus it is based off if he likes it or not.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Wonderful professor. He gives helpful criticism when it comes to improving your artwork. The lectures can be a bit monotonous but that might be because I took a class earlier in the day so I've almost dozed off. You will be drawing a lot in this class so expect lots of back to back sessions!

I took Professor Fisher for three classes, ART1100, ART1150, and ART2990 and they were all great, easy classes. He is super nice, helpful, and genuinely wants you to succeed and become a better artist. The work in some of the classes was tiring but that's just how school is. In my two in person classes with him, he'd always try to let us out early.

I had a fine experience in this course. Projects intentionally push you outside your comfort zone which can be good or bad depending on the person. He can be very wordy in his lectures, critiques, and class discussions so there were a lot of dozing students during his class. He is sweet and supportive, though, so it's not a stressful environment.

He was extremely unclear with directions. He graded harshly, at times saying a particular aspect of your art looked good in progress, but marking off points for the same thing in critique. Got a B in this class despite getting an A because he changed the project percentages without updating the syllabus. Also compares your work to other students'.

this professor will grade you based on comparing you to other students, not the effort you put in individually. the whole year i felt very demoralized because nothing i ma de was ever good enough for him. clearly has favortism towards certain students and it shows in how he gives feedback

Such a great professor. At first I was worried to take this professor as I had another professor lined up with perfect ratings. Im so glad I chose him instead. He gives amazing feedback on your projects and if you listen to him youll do completely fine. Gives tons of time to work on everything. Lectures can be boring but he tries to finish quickly
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: really cool class that gave me the opportunity to explore subject material & ideas i never would've otherwise done! plenty of time to brainstorm and work on each project, even if you don't like it you can get an A as long as you show that you put in work. will work with you for extra time/ideas if you need it. tendency to ramble haha. take him!

What I loved most about this class was his obvious passion for all things art.
Genuinely a great professor who cares for his craft and pushes his students to take creative routes with all of his projects. Critique days are long and grueling because he tends to talk a lot. Some assignments were confusing, but overall great professor! :)

Amazing. Take him! Homework is always to work on your projects, you don't have to come to class unless we present projects. He gives you about 2 weeks to work on each project. He is super caring, loves to converse, non-judgemental. He wants you to put yourself out there and give a full effort. Always says "sometimes art is just a good idea" 10/10!

Very nice man but a very hard grader. he expects way too much when the directions can be very simple. If you follow the directions down to every step he will give u a bad grade just because he "doesnt like it". He does give u the opportunity to revise a project that u want a better grade on but the amount of time spent doing each project is insane

Professor Fisher's class is great if you are a conceptual artist. There's a project every 2-3 weeks so it can be difficult if you don't have an idea. But, he will always reward an ambitious failure even if the final piece doesn't turn out! He leads good discussions and is an extremely fair grader so put it the effort and participate!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Fisher is pretty great. Projects are pretty simple and he's pretty straight forward when explaining his requirements. There's gonna be 8 assignments, a participation grade, and a final. There might be a midterm, but there wasn't one for me. He can be slightly picky depending on projects depending on skill level, but overall he was solid.

Great class! 6 projects, one of which is in groups. Each project is themed around a specific type of art (e.g., performance, installation, etc.), and pushes you to really think outside the box. No tests, books, or lectures, and a clear grading rubric is given. Excellent feedback from teacher, and you have the chance to make up one project.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Fisher was really nice. He gave us multiple projects for us to do and for us to think differently. It was a really fun and different class. There is one group project that you have to do where you can't verbally communicate, and, surprisingly, it was really fun!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: I worked hard to get an A in this class and still was only able to pass with a high B. He is a great professor and he allows you to revise all the assignments for a higher grade which is great. He doesn't always reply to emails quickly. Unless you think like an abstract artist, he's gonna make you work for it. Fun assignments though.

Prof Fisher is a positive guy, very organized. He gives you feedback on your projects in the rubric and you even get a chance to redo each project once for a replaced grade. When playing a review game for the midterm and final he asks the questions straight from the test. His projects were very time intensive

Professor Fisher is an amazing professor. He really cares about his students and tries to make sure everyone understands the criteria. He is a fair grader, though I feel that some of my classmates received a lower grade than they deserved. Show that you are working hard and he will respect you. An easygoing, fun guy overall.

Professor Fisher is honestly the best professor I've had yet, due to his focus on creativity. I'm excited to be taking his class once again, as he always inspires me to think outside the box to reach new and exciting conclusions. You NEED to show your process work to pass, though, so be prepared to keep a sketchbook or folder and WRITE STUFF DOWN.

Sure he certainly isn't the most conventional teacher, but most art teachers aren't. He expects his students to have a higher level of ingenuity but since he offers revisions and extra credit on every project it makes up for most difficulties. He strives to improve the educational system and cares about his students opinions.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He's nice and is willing to help but he grades hard and if you arent that crafty he will most likely fail you.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Fisher is nice, but he leaves class a lot, which is frustrating if you want to ask a question he'll be gone for half of the class. The rubrics for the projects could be a little clearer, instead of just one-line explanations. Most of the projects are non-objective, so don't take him if you're not comfortable with that. Allows revisions.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: While grading criteria and instructions can be a bit unclear at times, Professor Fisher offers extra credit and revisions throughout the semester (one revision per project, and how every many extra credit projects you would like to do) which makes it easier to make a better grade AND learn.

Overall a pretty good choice. Easy to talk to, knowledgable, and relaxed on late work and re-do projects. Only complaint would be that he can be inconsistent with his feedback and grading (if you really want that 4.0).
